Don't do that.  There's absolutely no reason to set a root password.
Also, you likely won't need to chmod either.  What are you trying to do to those files?
i wanna changse the game config and i cant since i am not the owner of the files
You'll use sudo with the command to edit the files: `gksu gedit /path/to/file` for instance (or sudo nano /path/to/config)
*dont* chmod
so i should type in "sudo nano /path/to/config/file
Yes.  And also, do `sudo passwd -l root` (to re-lock the root account)
that'll give you a nano window (text editor for the terminal) with the config file.  If you want to use a graphical editor, alt-f2 then gksu gedit /path/to/config/file
sudo nano  /usr/share/games/freeciv/nations afghani.ruleset
